item.title: Report E-2025020232
item.description:
Report E-2025020232

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-19T06:18:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-15
  • City: JACKSON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 116000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 15, 2025, at 1602 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Inway personnel in Jackson, TN regarding the release of several hazardous materials. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 48 pounds of UN3106 Organic Peroxide type D, 5.2, II from (5) 10-lbs plastic pails, 12 gallons of UN1866 Resin solution, 3, II from (2) 6-gallon metal pails, 80 gallons of UN1760 Corrosive liquids, 8, III from (16) 5-gallon metal pails, and 90 gallons of non-regulated Tremco Epoxy Primer Part A from (18) 5-gallon metal pails onto the ground. The release was reportedly due to a rollover accident during transit, impacting multiple areas of soil and asphalt. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was cleaned up with the proper PPE. Contractors removed the damaged product and repalletized the good product. All waste generated from addressing this release was placed into roll-off containers, which were taken off site by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025020210
item.description:
Report E-2025020210

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-17T21:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-16
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0600 ET, Andrew Slowinski with XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BNA. It was reported that approximately 2 quarts of UN2794 battery acid released from V Force Flat plate due to blocking and bracing. The release impacted trailer # 3171295. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The terminal used a 5-gallon poly drum for the waste and shrink wrapped the battery to a skid.

item.title: Report X-2025020558
item.description:
Report X-2025020558

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T03:17:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-05
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH location. The fiberboard box contained a single plastic bottle that was packaged in a paper envelope with bubble wrap for dunnage. The cap on the plastic bottle was loose causing a release of the contents. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
